intro: Palicourea antioquiana, commonly known as the Antioquian moonseed, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
